analyzed: na akāraṇena tathāgatāḥ sitam pātukaronti iti
translated: The Buddhas do not smile without a reason.”

translated: “What is the reason, what is the cause, for the Buddha’s smile?

translated: The Buddhas do not smile without a reason.”

translated: “Once, Ananda, in this very Mithila there was a king named Maghadeva, a righteous king, a king of righteousness, a king who was established in the Dhamma, a great king.

analyzed: dhammam carati brāhmaṇa gahapatikesu negamesu ca iva jānapadesu ca

translated: and he observed the Uposatha days on the fourteenth, fifteenth, and eighth of the fortnight.

analyzed: uposatham ca upavasati cātuddasim pañcadasim aṭṭhamim ca pakkhassa ati
translated: and he observes the Uposatha days on the fourteenth, fifteenth, and eighth of the fortnight.’

original: Devā te, mahārāja, tāvatiṁsā dassanakāmā.
analyzed: devā te mahā rāja tāvatisā dassana kāmā
translated: The gods, great king, the Thirty-Three, want to see you.

original: Abhirama, mahārāja, devesu devānubhāvenā’ti.
analyzed: abhirama mahā rāja devesu deva anubhāvena ati
translated: Enjoy yourself, great king, among the gods with the power of the gods.’

original: ‘Alaṁ, mārisa, tattheva maṁ mithilaṁ paṭinetu.
analyzed: ala mārisa tattha iva mam mithilam paṭinetu
translated: ‘Enough, good sir. Send me back to Mithila.

original: Tathāhaṁ dhammaṁ carissāmi brāhmaṇagahapatikesu negamesu ceva jānapadesu ca;
analyzed: tathā aham dhammam carissāmi brāhmaṇa gahapatikesu negamesu ca iva jānapadesu ca
translated: There I will practice the Dhamma among brahmins and householders, among town-dwellers and country-folk,

original: uposathañca upavasāmi cātuddasiṁ pañcadasiṁ aṭṭhamiñca pakkhassā’ti.
analyzed: uposatham ca upavasāmi cātuddasim pañcadasim aṭṭhamim ca pakkhassa ati
translated: and I will observe the Uposatha days on the fourteenth, fifteenth, and eighth of the fortnight.’

original: Atha kho, ānanda, sakko devānamindo mātaliṁ saṅgāhakaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha khalu ānanda sakkaḥ devānamindaḥ mātalim saṅgāhakam āmantesi
translated: Then Sakka, ruler of gods, addressed the charioteer Matali:

original: ‘ehi tvaṁ, samma mātali, sahassayuttaṁ ājaññarathaṁ yojetvā nimiṁ rājānaṁ tattheva mithilaṁ paṭinehī’ti.
analyzed: ehi tva samma mātali sahassa yuttam ājañña ratham yojetvā nimim rājānam tattha iva mithilam paṭinehi iti
translated: ‘Come, good Matali, prepare the chariot harnessed to a thousand thoroughbreds and drive King Nimi back to Mithila.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, bhaddantavā’ti kho, ānanda, mātali saṅgāhako sakkassa devānamindassa paṭissutvā sahassayuttaṁ ājaññarathaṁ yojetvā nimiṁ rājānaṁ tattheva mithilaṁ paṭinesi.
analyzed: eva bhaddantavāti kho ānanda mātali saṅgāhakaḥ sakkassa devānamindassa paṭissutvā sahassa yuttam ājañña ratham yojetvā nimim rājānam tattha eva mithilam paṭinesi
translated: ‘Yes, Lord’, said Matali and did so.

original: Tatra sudaṁ, ānanda, nimi rājā dhammaṁ carati brāhmaṇagahapatikesu negamesu ceva jānapadesu ca, uposathañca upavasati cātuddasiṁ pañcadasiṁ aṭṭhamiñca pakkhassāti.
analyzed: tatra sudaḥ ānanda nimi rājā dhammam carati brāhmaṇa gahapatikesu negamesu ca iva jānapadesu ca uposatham ca upavasati cātuddasim pañcadasim aṭṭhamim ca pakkhassa ati
translated: And there King Nimi lived righteously towards all creatures, and he observed the Uposatha days on the fourteenth, fifteenth and eighth of the fortnight.

original: Atha kho, ānanda, nimi rājā bahūnaṁ vassānaṁ bahūnaṁ vassasatānaṁ bahūnaṁ vassasahassānaṁ accayena kappakaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho ānanda nimi rājā bahūnam vassānam bahūnam vassa satānam bahūnam vassa sahassānam accayena kappakam āmantesi
translated: Then after many years, many hundreds and thousands of years, King Nimi addressed his barber:

original: ‘yadā me, samma kappaka, passeyyāsi sirasmiṁ palitāni jātāni, atha me āroceyyāsī’ti.
analyzed: yadā me samma kappaka passeyyāsi sirasmim palitāni jātāni atha me āroceyyāsi iti
translated: ‘When you see grey hairs growing on my head, then inform me.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, ānanda, kappako nimissa rañño paccassosi.
analyzed: eva deva ati kho ānanda kappakaḥ nimissa rañño paccassosi
translated: ‘Yes, Your Majesty,’ Kappaka replied.

original: Addasā kho, ānanda, kappako bahūnaṁ vassānaṁ bahūnaṁ vassasatānaṁ bahūnaṁ vassasahassānaṁ accayena nimissa rañño sirasmiṁ palitāni jātāni.
analyzed: addasā kho ānanda kappakaḥ bahūnam vassānam bahūnam vassa satānam bahūnam vassa sahassānam accayena nimissa rañño sirasmiṃ palitāni jātāni
translated: After many years, many hundreds of years, many thousands of years had passed, Kappaka saw that grey hairs were growing on King Nimi’s head.

original: Disvāna nimiṁ rājānaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvāna nimim rājānam etat avoca
translated: He said to Nimi,

original: ‘pātubhūtā kho devassa devadūtā;
analyzed: pātubhūtā kho devassa deva dūtā
translated: ‘Your Majesty, the divine messengers have appeared.

original: dissanti sirasmiṁ palitāni jātānī’ti.
analyzed: dissanti sirasmim palitāni jātāni iti
translated: Grey hairs are seen growing on your head.’

original: ‘Tena hi, samma kappaka, tāni palitāni sādhukaṁ saṇḍāsena uddharitvā mama añjalismiṁ patiṭṭhāpehī’ti.
analyzed: tena hi samma kappaka tāni palitāni sādhukam saṇḍāsena uddharitvā mama añjalismim patiṭṭhāpehi iti
translated: ‘Well then, Kappaka, carefully pull out those grey hairs and place them in the palm of my hand.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, ānanda, kappako nimissa rañño paṭissutvā tāni palitāni sādhukaṁ saṇḍāsena uddharitvā nimissa rañño añjalismiṁ patiṭṭhāpesi.
analyzed: eva deva ati kho ānanda kappakaḥ nimissa rañño paṭissutvā tāni palitāni sādhukam saṇḍāsena uddharitvā nimissa rañño añjalismiṃ patiṭṭhāpesi
translated: ‘Yes, Your Majesty,’ Kappaka replied. He carefully pulled out the grey hairs and placed them in the palm of King Nimi’s hand.

original: Atha kho, ānanda, nimi rājā kappakassa gāmavaraṁ datvā jeṭṭhaputtaṁ kumāraṁ āmantāpetvā etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho ānanda nimi rājā kappakassa gāma varam da tvā jeṭṭha puttam kumāram āmantāpetvā etat avoca
translated: Then, having given the village to the barber, King Nimi addressed his eldest son, the prince:

original: ‘pātubhūtā kho me, tāta kumāra, devadūtā;🔽dissanti sirasmiṁ palitāni jātāni;
analyzed: pātubhūtā khalu me tāta kumāra deva dūtā  dissanti sirasmim palitāni jātāni
translated: ‘Dear prince, the divine messengers have appeared to me;🔽I see grey hairs growing on my head.

original: bhuttā kho pana me mānusakā kāmā;
analyzed: bhuttā kho pana me mānusakā kāmā
translated: I have enjoyed human sensual pleasures;

original: samayo dibbe kāme pariyesituṁ.
analyzed: samayaḥ dibbe kāme pariyesitu
translated: it is time for me to seek divine sensual pleasures.

original: Ehi tvaṁ, tāta kumāra, imaṁ rajjaṁ paṭipajja.
analyzed: ehi tva tāta kumāraḥ imam rajjam paṭipajja
translated: Come, dear prince, take over the kingship.🔽I will shave off my hair and beard, put on the yellow robe,

original: Ahaṁ pana kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajissāmi.🔽Tena hi, tāta kumāra, yadā tvampi passeyyāsi sirasmiṁ palitāni jātāni, atha kappakassa
analyzed: aham pana kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajissāmi  tena hi tāta kumāra yadā tvam pi passeyyāsi sirasmim palitāni jātāni atha kappakassa
translated: and go forth from the home life into homelessness.🔽So, dear prince, when you see grey hairs growing on your head, then give the village to the barber

original: gāmavaraṁ datvā jeṭṭhaputtaṁ kumāraṁ sādhukaṁ rajje samanusāsitvā kesamassuṁ ohāretvā
analyzed: gām avaram da tvā jeṭṭha puttam kumāram sādhukam rajje samanusāsitvā kesa massum ohāretvā
translated: and instruct your eldest son, the prince, well in kingship. Then you should shave off your hair and beard,

original: kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyyāsi.
analyzed: kāsāyāni vatthāni a chādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajeyyāsi
translated: put on the yellow robe, and go forth from the home life into homelessness.’

original: Yena me idaṁ kalyāṇaṁ vattaṁ nihitaṁ anuppavatteyyāsi, mā kho me tvaṁ antimapuriso ahosi.
analyzed: yena me idam kalyāṇam vattam nihitam anuppavatteyya asi mā kho me tvam antima purisaḥ ahosi
translated: and you should continue to do so. Don’t be the last person to let this good practice lapse.

original: Yasmiṁ kho, tāta kumāra, purisayuge vattamāne evarūpassa kalyāṇassa vattassa samucchedo hoti so tesaṁ antimapuriso hoti.
analyzed: yasmin kho tāta kumāra purisa yuge vattamāne evarūpassa kalyāṇassa vattassa samucchedaḥ hoti saḥ tesam antima purisaḥ hoti
translated: In the case of a couple where this good practice is discontinued, the husband is the last person to let it lapse.

original: Taṁ tāhaṁ, tāta kumāra, evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: tam tā āha tāta kumāraḥ evam vadāmi
translated: Therefore, dear Prince, I say to you:

original: “yena me idaṁ kalyāṇaṁ vattaṁ nihitaṁ anuppavatteyyāsi, mā kho me tvaṁ antimapuriso ahosī”’ti.
analyzed: yena me idam kalyāṇam vattam nihitam anuppavatteyya asi mā kho me tvam antima purisaḥ ahosi iti
translated: and you should continue to do so. Don’t be the last person to let it lapse.’🔽“Then King Nimi, having given the village grant to the barber,

original: Atha kho, ānanda, nimi rājā kappakassa gāmavaraṁ datvā jeṭṭhaputtaṁ kumāraṁ sādhukaṁ🔽rajje samanusāsitvā imasmiṁyeva maghadevaambavane kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni
analyzed: atha kho ānanda nimi rājā kappakassa gāma varam da tvā jeṭṭha puttam kumāram sādhuka  rajje samanusāsitvā imasmiyā iva maghadeva ambavane kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni
translated: having instructed his eldest son well in the kingship,

original: acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbaji.
analyzed: a chādetvā agārasmai anagāriyam pabbaji
translated: having shaved off his hair and beard, having put on the yellow robe, went forth from the home life into homelessness in Magadha right here in the Mango Grove.

original: So mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā vihāsi, tathā dutiyaṁ, tathā tatiyaṁ,
analyzed: saḥ mettā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam vihāsi tathā dutiya tathā tatiya
translated: He dwelled pervading one quarter with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, likewise the second, likewise the third, likewise the fourth;

original: tathā catutthaṁ; iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ mettāsahagatena
analyzed: tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam mettā sahagatena
translated: and the fourth, in the same way. Thus above, below, across, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he abides pervading the entire world with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, vast, exalted, measureless, without hostility, without ill will.🔽

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena pharitvā vihāsi.🔽Karuṇāsahagatena cetasā …
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena pharitvā vihāsi  karuṇā sahagatena cetasā
translated: So above, below, across, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he abided pervading the entire world with a mind imbued with loving-kindness, vast, exalted, measureless, without hostility, without ill will.🔽With a mind imbued with compassion…

original: muditāsahagatena cetasā …
analyzed: muditā sahagatena cetasā
translated: with a mind imbued with sympathetic joy…

original: upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā vihāsi, tathā dutiyaṁ, tathā tatiyaṁ,🔽tathā catutthaṁ; iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ upekkhāsahagatena
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatena cetasā ekam disam pharitvā vihāsi tathā dutiya tathā tatiya  tathā catutthaḥ iti uddham adhas tiriyam sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantam lokam upekkhā sahagatena
translated: with a mind imbued with equanimity…

original: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena pharitvā vihāsi.🔽Nimi kho panānanda, rājā caturāsītivassasahassāni kumārakīḷitaṁ kīḷi, caturāsītivassasahassāni
analyzed: cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyābajjhena pharitvā vihāsi  nimi kho pana ānanda rājā catur asīti vassa sahassāni kumārakīḷitam kīḷi catur asīti vassa sahassāni
translated: So above, below, across, and everywhere, and to all as to himself, he abided pervading the entire world with a mind imbued with equanimity, vast, exalted, measureless, without hostility, without ill will.🔽King Nimi, Ānanda, played at making love for eighty-four thousand years,🔽he acted as viceroy for eighty-four thousand years, he reigned as king for eighty-four thousand years,

original: oparajjaṁ kāresi, caturāsītivassasahassāni rajjaṁ kāresi, caturāsītivassasahassāni
analyzed: oparajjam kāresi catur asīti vassa sahassāni rajjam kāresi catur asīti vassa sahassāni
translated: and

original: imasmiṁyeva maghadevaambavane agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito brahmacariyamacari.
analyzed: imasmiyā iva maghadeva ambavane agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajitaḥ brahmacariyam acari
translated: and right here in the Magadhan capital of Ambapālī’s Wood he went forth into homelessness.

original: So cattāro brahmavihāre bhāvetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā brahmalokūpago ahosi.
analyzed: so cattāraḥ brahmavihāre bhāvetvā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā brahma loka upagaḥ ahosi
translated: He developed the four divine abodes and, at the break-up of the body, after death, he was reborn in the company of the gods of the Brahma-world.

original: Nimissa kho panānanda, rañño kaḷārajanako nāma putto ahosi.
analyzed: nimissa kho pana ānanda rañño kaḷārajanakaḥ nāma putto ahosi
translated: Now, Ānanda, King Nimī had a son named Kaḷāra.

original: Na so agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbaji.🔽So taṁ kalyāṇaṁ vattaṁ samucchindi.
analyzed: na saḥ agārasmai anagāriyam pabbaji  saḥ tam kalyāṇam vattam
translated: He did not go forth from the home life into homelessness.🔽He broke the continuity of that good practice.

original: So tesaṁ antimapuriso ahosi.
analyzed: saḥ tesam antima purisaḥ ahosi
translated: He was the last man.

original: Siyā kho pana te, ānanda, evamassa:
analyzed: siyā kho pana te ānanda evam assa
translated: Ānanda, you may think:

original: ‘añño nūna tena samayena rājā maghadevo ahosi, yena taṁ kalyāṇaṁ vattaṁ nihitan’ti.
analyzed: aññaḥ nūna tena samayena rājā maghadevaḥ ahosi yena tam kalyāṇam vattam nihitanti
translated: ‘Surely, the one who established that good practice was the king of Magadha, Maghadeva?’

original: Na kho panetaṁ, ānanda, evaṁ daṭṭhabbaṁ.🔽Ahaṁ tena samayena rājā maghadevo ahosiṁ.
analyzed: na kho pana itas ānanda evam  aham tena samayena rājā maghadevaḥ
translated: But you should not regard it in this way.🔽I was the king of Magadha, Maghadeva, at that time.

original: Ahaṁ taṁ kalyāṇaṁ vattaṁ nihiniṁ, mayā taṁ kalyāṇaṁ vattaṁ nihitaṁ;
analyzed: aham tam kalyāṇam vattam mayā tam kalyāṇam vattam
translated: I was the one who established that good practice.

original: pacchimā janatā anuppavattesi.
analyzed: pacchimā janatā anuppavattesi
translated: The people of later generations continued it.

original: Taṁ kho panānanda, kalyāṇaṁ vattaṁ na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṁvattati, yāvadeva brahmalokūpapattiyā.🔽Idaṁ kho panānanda, etarahi mayā kalyāṇaṁ vattaṁ nihitaṁ ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: tat kho pana ānanda kalyāṇam vattam na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya savattati yāvat eva brahma loka upapattiyā  idam kho pana ānanda etarahi mayā kalyāṇam vattam nihitam ekanta nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: But that good practice does not lead to disenchantment, to dispassion, to cessation, to peace, to direct knowledge, to enlightenment, to Nibbana, but only to reappearance in the Brahma-world.🔽But the good practice that I now enjoin does lead to disenchantment, to dispassion, to cessation, to peace, to direct knowledge, to enlightenment, to Nibbana.

original: Katamañcānanda, etarahi mayā kalyāṇaṁ vattaṁ nihitaṁ ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati?🔽Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: katamat ca ānanda etarahi mayā kalyāṇam vattam nihitam ekanta nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati  ayam eva ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo
translated: And what is that good practice that I now enjoin?

original: sammādiṭṭhi, sammāsaṅkappo, sammāvācā, sammākammanto, sammāājīvo, sammāvāyāmo, sammāsati, sammāsamādhi.
analyzed: sammā diṭṭhi sammā saṅkappo sammā vācā sammā kammanto sammā ājīvaḥ sammā vāyāmaḥ sammā sati sammā samādhi
translated: It is this noble eightfold path, that is, right view, right resolve, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, etarahi mayā kalyāṇaṁ vattaṁ nihitaṁ ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: idam kho ānanda etarahi mayā kalyāṇam vattam nihitam ekanta nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati
translated: This good practice that I have established now leads exclusively to disenchantment, dispassion, cessation, peace, direct knowledge, enlightenment, and Nibbāna.

original: Taṁ vo ahaṁ, ānanda, evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: tam vaḥ aha ānanda evam vadāmi
translated: I tell you, Ānanda,

original: ‘yena me idaṁ kalyāṇaṁ vattaṁ nihitaṁ anuppavatteyyātha, mā kho me tumhe antimapurisā ahuvattha’.
analyzed: yena me idam kalyāṇam vattam nihitam mā kho me tumhe antima purisāḥ ahuvattha
translated: that you should continue to practice this good practice so that you will not be the last person to let it die out.”

original: Yasmiṁ kho, ānanda, purisayuge vattamāne evarūpassa kalyāṇassa vattassa samucchedo hoti so tesaṁ antimapuriso hoti.
analyzed: yasmin kho ānanda purisa yuge vattamāne evarūpassa kalyāṇassa vattassa samucchedaḥ hoti saḥ tesam antima purisaḥ hoti
translated: “Ānanda, when a good practice is dying out, the person in the generation that lets it die out is the last person.

original: Taṁ vo ahaṁ, ānanda, evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: tam vaḥ aha ānanda evam vadāmi
translated: I tell you, Ānanda,

original: ‘yena me idaṁ kalyāṇaṁ vattaṁ nihitaṁ anuppavatteyyātha, mā kho me tumhe antimapurisā ahuvatthā’”ti.
analyzed: yena me idam kalyāṇam vattam nihitam mā kho me tumhe antima purisāḥ ahuvattha ati
translated: that you should continue to practice this good practice so that you will not be the last person to let it die out.”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: That is what the Buddha said.

original: Attamano āyasmā ānando bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandīti.
analyzed: āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinandi iti
translated: Pleased, the Venerable Ānanda was happy with what the Buddha said.

original: Maghadevasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: maghadeva suttam niṭṭhitam tatiya
translated: The third section for recitation on Maghadeva is finished.
